reply_text:
Thank you for your feedback. Your experience certainly seems to be a lot different from most of the other people's experience. In fact, we pride ourselves that we spend a lot of time and attention on each and every patient. 
Continuing the same medications just means that one has to be patient and wait. While we all would like to get our children cured in a jiffy, the fact remains that there are no magic bullets! Every medicine that is given has effects and has SIDE EFFECTS. Stronger the medication, more the side-effects.
As far as workshops are concerned, each is a different workshop and lasts for an hour each. A lot of time and effort has gone into each Powerpoint presentation. We make sure that they are useful to the parents and arrange to get aids (this time around much to your surprise the people who supplied us the kits for demonstration purposes were Ardo and not Medela, though we have asked them to show the kits earlier for demonstration and hands on experience. Unfortunately, we don't manufacture generic kits at home!!! You have chosen to be critical rather than appreciate the efforts put in to make the experience worthwhile to the attendees. Most people have been grateful and appreciative.
But we wish you all the very best in your search for a pediatrician that will suit your child.

review: Took appointment for vaccination  of my kids. They haven't revealed the charges on phone and after meeting Dr she asked for almost 30% more on MRP of each injection. When raised concern she sarcastically said go to govt hospital.* * ***** **** *** **** ******* *** ***** *** ********* ****** **** *** *** why can't they respond to this query on mail or phone when they are so active online. Finally she charged consultation just for letting us know the price and noting down stuff what do we use. Strongly advice not to visit this place if you don't want to be ripped off.
reply_text:
Thank you for taking the trouble to write a long, but an unfair review. We reviewed your visit which was yesterday; you had come in asking for only vaccine administration. You then proceeded to spend half an hour in the consulting room discussing the feeding schedule, the vaccines that were to be administered, the bathing of the child, and in general the rearing of the child. This is what constitutes a consultation for your baby from a pediatrician.
If you wanted only vaccinations, you should have brought in a list of vaccines that you wanted to be administered and say, please administer these vaccines. You cannot ask for vaccines that are due at eight weeks of age. The knowledge and expertise required to determine which vaccines are needed at a particular age are what you pay for in a consultation.
I understand that you would like to reduce the cost and who wouldn't? I suggest the following ways:
You could buy the vaccines from a friendly neighborhood chemist and get It administered by any doctor who is willing to. We do not administer vaccines brought in from outside, because we want to ensure that the vaccine is stored in perfect circumstances and we go to great lengths to maintain the cold chain that vaccines require. We even have a dial thermometer that checks the temperature inside the refrigerator where we keep the vaccines. We maintain electronic medical records and send out reminders to our patients for vaccinations due. Almost all our patients genuinely appreciate it.
A better option is to take it from the municipal hospitals. You chose to interpret it as sarcasm, but it was in good faith. Here, the cold chain is assured, and on the cold chain, depends the effectiveness of the vaccine. This is a far better option than the previous one.
We realize that it is not possible to please everybody. We wish you all the best in your search for a cheap and effective vaccine and hope that your child a healthy future
